official_title: Associate Director of English for Academic Purposes and Lecturer
bio:
Brandon Conlon is Associate Director of English for Academic Purposes and Lecturer at NYU Shanghai. Prior to joining NYU Shanghai, he was English for academic purposes lecturer at Xian Jiaotong-Liverpool University. He is currently pursuing an EdD in higher education from the University of Liverpool. He holds a master's in applied linguistics from the University of New England (Australia) and a BA in linguistics and philosophy from the University of Massachusetts, Amherst.

Conlon's research interests are language and culture teaching and acquisition, higher education, and the relation between curriculum, pedagogy, and culture. At Xian Jiaotong-Liverpool University, he designed a language course for English and communication students in their second year. He has designed and taught a range of language intensive courses that include English for academic purposes, composition, culture, lexicology, and introductory linguistics. He is a member of Teachers of English to Speakers of Other Languages, USA (TESOL).

Research Interests

  • Language and culture teaching, learning, and acquisition
  • Higher education
  • Relation between curriculum, pedagogy, and culture

Courses Taught

  • Global Perspectives on Society - Writing Workshop
  • EAP Seminar: Negotiating Self and Others - Advanced
  • Intercultural Communication
